item.description:
Yup, we revisit the hard problem, but this time not to futilely chase a solution. Rather, we'll try to figure out why there is no consensus on just what the problem is -- or even if there is anything worth worrying about at all? To get us going, I'll start with a presentation of my own somewhat weird-looking thesis on this -- and what it might imply for any eventual purported solution -- but in our usual undisciplined manner I'm sure we'll take the discussion to still weirder places.

For newcomers: a quick and dirty on the so-called 'hard problem' can be found at this Wiki entry . A classic illustration of the hard problem are zombies
